org.forgerock.cuppa

Class Cuppa

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.cuppa.Cuppa

  • public final class Cuppa
extends java.lang.Object
    Use the methods of this class to define your tests.

    Annotate your class with Test.

    
 public class ListTest {
   {
     describe("List", () -> {
       describe("#indexOf", () -> {
         it("returns -1 when the value is not present", () -> {
           List<Integer> list = Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3);
           assertThat(list.indexOf(5)).isEqualTo(-1);
         });
       });
     });
   }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • describe

        public static void describe(java.lang.String description,
                            TestBlockFunction function)
        Registers a 'describe' block of tests.

        Use 'describe' blocks to group together tests that describe the same thing. Blocks may be nested within other blocks.

        Parameters:
        description - The description of the 'describe' block. Used solely for reporting.
        function - A function that will define tests and/or test blocks. This function will be executed immediately.

      • when

        public static void when(java.lang.String description,
                        TestBlockFunction function)
        Registers a 'when' block of tests.

        Use 'when' blocks to group together tests that share some context. Blocks may be nested within other blocks.

        Parameters:
        description - The description of the 'when' block. Used solely for reporting.
        function - A function that will define tests and/or test blocks. This function will be executed immediately.

      • it

        public static void it(java.lang.String description)
        Registers a pending test.

        A pending test has no implementation and acts as a reminder to the developer to write the implementation later.

        Parameters:
        description - A description of the behaviour that this test will assert.

      • with

        public static TestBuilder with(Option<?>... options)
        Decorate a test or block of tests with additional options. Options are constructed via factory methods. For example, see tags(String...).

        Multiple options can be either passed as additional arguments or chained using the returned builder.

        
 with(tags("slow")).
 it("takes a long time to start", () -> {
   // ...
 });
        Parameters:
        options - Options to apply to the test/block.
        Returns:
        An object for building a test or test block with the given options.
        See Also:
        tags(String...)

      • skip

        public static TestBuilder skip()
        Mark a test or block of tests to be skipped.

        The test(s) may still be included in test reports, but marked as skipped.

        
 skip().it("does something", () -> {
   // Will not be run.
 });
        Returns:
        An object for building the test or test block that will be skipped.

      • only

        public static TestBuilder only()
        Mark a test or block of tests as the only tests that should be run.

        If at least one test is marked as only then all tests not marked as only will not be run.

        
 only().it("does something", () -> {
   // ...
 });
        Returns:
        An object for building the test or test block that will be run.

      • tags

        public static Option tags(java.lang.String... tags)
        Decorates tests with a set of tags. Tags can be used to group tests together to be included or excluded from a test run.

        Apply to a test or block of tests by passing the result of this method to with(Option...).

        
 with(tags("slow")).
 it("takes a long time to start", () -> {
   // ...
 });
        Parameters:
        tags - String identifiers that can be used when running Cuppa to include or exclude a test/block.
        Returns:
        An option, which can be passed to with(Option...).
        See Also:
        with(Option...)
